query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Già eran li occhi miei rifissi al volto 2 de la mia donna, e l’animo con essi, 3 e da ogne altro intento s’era tolto.
query.result: 1 Already were my eyes fixed on the face 2 of my lady, and my mind with them, 3 and from every other thought it had withdrawn itself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 E quella non ridea; ma «S’io ridessi», 5 mi cominciò, «tu ti faresti quale 6 fu Semelè quando di cener fessi:
7 ché la bellezza mia, che per le scale 8 de l’etterno palazzo più s’accende, 9 com’ hai veduto, quanto più si sale,
10 se non si temperasse, tanto splende, 11 che ’l tuo mortal podere, al suo fulgore, 12 sarebbe fronda che trono scoscende.
query.result:
4 And she did not laugh; but "If I were to laugh," 5 she began to me, "you would become like 6 Semele when she turned to ashes:
7 for my beauty, which is kindled more 8 on the stairs of the eternal palace, 9 as you have seen, the higher one ascends,
10 if it were not tempered, shines so brightly 11 that your mortal capacity, in its radiance, 12 would be a leaf that a thunderbolt knocks down.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Noi sem levati al settimo splendore, 14 che sotto ’l petto del Leone ardente 15 raggia mo misto giù del suo valore.
query.result: 13 We have risen to the seventh splendor, 14 which beneath the breast of the fiery Lion 15 radiates now mingled with his power.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Ficca di retro a li occhi tuoi la mente, 17 e fa di quelli specchi a la figura 18 che ’n questo specchio ti sarà parvente».
query.result: 16 Fix your mind behind your eyes, 17 and make of them mirrors to the image 18 that will appear to you in this mirror.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Qual savesse qual era la pastura 20 del viso mio ne l’aspetto beato 21 quand’ io mi trasmutai ad altra cura,
22 conoscerebbe quanto m’era a grato 23 ubidire a la mia celeste scorta, 24 contrapesando l’un con l’altro lato.
query.result:
19 If one could know what was the nourishment 20 of my gaze on the blessed aspect 21 when I turned to another concern,
22 one would understand how pleasing it was to me 23 to obey my celestial guide, 24 weighing the one side against the other.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Dentro al cristallo che ’l vocabol porta, 26 cerchiando il mondo, del suo caro duce 27 sotto cui giacque ogne malizia morta,
28 di color d’oro in che raggio traluce 29 vid’ io uno scaleo eretto in suso 30 tanto, che nol seguiva la mia luce.
query.result:
25 Within the crystal that bears the name, 26 encircling the world, of its dear leader 27 beneath whom every evil lies slain,
28 in a golden color through which a ray shines, 29 I saw a stairway rising upward 30 so high that my sight could not follow it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Vidi anche per li gradi scender giuso 32 tanti splendor, ch’io pensai ch’ogne lume 33 che par nel ciel, quindi fosse diffuso.
query.result: 31 I also saw so many splendors descending 32 down the steps that I thought every light 33 that appears in the sky was diffused from there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 E quel che presso più ci si ritenne, 44 si fé sì chiaro, ch’io dicea pensando: 45 ‘Io veggio ben l’amor che tu m’accenne.
query.result: 43 And the one that remained closest to us 44 became so bright that I said, thinking: 45 ‘I see well the love that you signal to me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Ma quella ond’ io aspetto il come e ’l quando 47 del dire e del tacer, si sta; ond’ io, 48 contra ’l disio, fo ben ch’io non dimando’.
query.result: 46 But the one from whom I await the how and when 47 of speaking and being silent remains still; therefore I, 48 against my desire, do well not to ask’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Per ch’ella, che vedëa il tacer mio 50 nel veder di colui che tutto vede, 51 mi disse: «Solvi il tuo caldo disio».
query.result: 49 Because she, who saw my silence 50 in the sight of him who sees everything, 51 said to me: “Resolve your ardent desire”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 E io incominciai: «La mia mercede 53 non mi fa degno de la tua risposta; 54 ma per colei che ’l chieder mi concede,
55 vita beata che ti stai nascosta 56 dentro a la tua letizia, fammi nota 57 la cagion che sì presso mi t’ha posta;
58 e dì perché si tace in questa rota 59 la dolce sinfonia di paradiso, 60 che giù per l’altre suona sì divota».

Please translate each line literally into English.
61 «Tu hai l’udir mortal sì come il viso», 62 rispuose a me; «onde qui non si canta 63 per quel che Bëatrice non ha riso.
query.result: 61 “Your hearing is as mortal as your sight”, 62 she replied to me; “therefore one does not sing here 63 for the reason that Beatrice has not smiled.

64 Down the steps of the holy stairway 65 I descended only to do you honor 66 with speech and with the light that cloaks me;
67 nor did greater love make me more prompt, 68 for as much and even more love burns up here, 69 as the flaming reveals to you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Ma l’alta carità, che ci fa serve 71 pronte al consiglio che ’l mondo governa, 72 sorteggia qui sì come tu osserve».
query.result: 70 But the high charity, which makes us handmaidens 71 ready for the counsel that governs the world, 72 draws lots here, as you observe”.

73 “I see well,” I said, “sacred lamp, 74 how free love in this court 75 suffices to follow eternal providence;
76 but this is what I find hard to discern, 77 why you alone were predestined 78 for this office among your companions”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Né venni prima a l’ultima parola, 80 che del suo mezzo fece il lume centro, 81 girando sé come veloce mola;
82 poi rispuose l’amor che v’era dentro: 83 «Luce divina sopra me s’appunta, 84 penetrando per questa in ch’io m’inventro,
85 la cui virtù, col mio veder congiunta, 86 mi leva sopra me tanto, ch’i’ veggio 87 la somma essenza de la quale è munta.

Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Quinci vien l’allegrezza ond’ io fiammeggio; 89 per ch’a la vista mia, quant’ ella è chiara, 90 la chiarità de la fiamma pareggio.

Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Ma quell’ alma nel ciel che più si schiara, 92 quel serafin che ’n Dio più l’occhio ha fisso, 93 a la dimanda tua non satisfara,
94 però che sì s’innoltra ne lo abisso 95 de l’etterno statuto quel che chiedi, 96 che da ogne creata vista è scisso.
query.result:
91 But that soul in heaven that shines the brightest, 92 that seraph who fixes his gaze on God the most, 93 would not satisfy your request,
94 because what you ask delves so deeply into the abyss 95 of the eternal decree that it is cut off 96 from every created sight.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 E al mondo mortal, quando tu riedi, 98 questo rapporta, sì che non presumma 99 a tanto segno più mover li piedi.
query.result: 97 And when you return to the mortal world, 98 report this, so that no one presumes 99 to set foot on so lofty a path.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 La mente, che qui luce, in terra fumma; 101 onde riguarda come può là giùe 102 quel che non pote perché ’l ciel l’assumma».

Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Sì mi prescrisser le parole sue, 104 ch’io lasciai la quistione e mi ritrassi 105 a dimandarla umilmente chi fue.
query.result: 103 His words so bound me 104 that I dropped the question and humbly turned 105 to ask him who he was.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 «Tra ’ due liti d’Italia surgon sassi, 107 e non molto distanti a la tua patria, 108 tanto che ’ troni assai suonan più bassi,
109 e fanno un gibbo che si chiama Catria, 110 di sotto al quale è consecrato un ermo, 111 che suole esser disposto a sola latria».
query.result:
106 “Between the two shores of Italy rise rocks, 107 and not very far from your homeland, 108 so much so that the thunderbolts sound much lower,
109 and they form a hump that is called Catria, 110 beneath which a hermitage is consecrated, 111 which is usually dedicated to solitary worship”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Così ricominciommi il terzo sermo; 113 e poi, continüando, disse: «Quivi 114 al servigio di Dio mi fe’ sì fermo,
115 che pur con cibi di liquor d’ulivi 116 lievemente passava caldi e geli, 117 contento ne’ pensier contemplativi.
query.result:
112 Thus the third spirit began again to speak to me; 113 and then, continuing, he said: “There 114 I made myself so steadfast in the service of God,
115 that with only food of olive oil 116 I passed through heat and cold with ease, 117 content in contemplative thoughts.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Render solea quel chiostro a questi cieli 119 fertilemente; e ora è fatto vano, 120 sì che tosto convien che si riveli.

Please translate each line literally into English.
121 In quel loco fu’ io Pietro Damiano, 122 e Pietro Peccator fu’ ne la casa 123 di Nostra Donna in sul lito adriano.
query.result: 121 In that place I was Peter Damian, 122 and I was Peter the Sinner in the house 123 of Our Lady on the Adriatic shore.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Poca vita mortal m’era rimasa, 125 quando fui chiesto e tratto a quel cappello, 126 che pur di male in peggio si travasa.
query.result: 124 Little mortal life remained to me 125 when I was asked for and drawn to that hat, 126 which is transferred from bad to worse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Venne Cefàs e venne il gran vasello 128 de lo Spirito Santo, magri e scalzi, 129 prendendo il cibo da qualunque ostello.
query.result: 127 Cephas came and the great vessel 128 of the Holy Spirit came, lean and barefoot, 129 taking food from any inn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Or voglion quinci e quindi chi rincalzi 131 li moderni pastori e chi li meni, 132 tanto son gravi, e chi di rietro li alzi.
query.result: 130 Now they want someone from here and there to prop up 131 the modern shepherds and someone to lead them, 132 so heavy are they, and someone to lift them up from behind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Cuopron d’i manti loro i palafreni, 134 sì che due bestie van sott’ una pelle: 135 oh pazïenza che tanto sostieni!».
query.result: 133 They cover their palfreys with their mantles, 134 so that two beasts go under one skin: 135 oh patience, that you endure so much!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 A questa voce vid’ io più fiammelle 137 di grado in grado scendere e girarsi, 138 e ogne giro le facea più belle.
query.result: 136 At this voice I saw more flames 137 descend and wheel from level to level, 138 and each revolution made them more beautiful.

139 They came around this one and stopped, 140 and uttered a cry of such a high pitch 141 that it could not be likened to anything here;
142 nor did I understand it, so much did the thunder overcome me.
